dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, big news out of Detroit this week, huh? GM, like, making a really aggressive push into electric vehicles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, big news out of Detroit this week, huh? G M, like, making a really aggressive push into electric vehicles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla wasnt mentioned in a presentation by CEO and Chairman Mary Barra to Barclays Global Automotive conference, but the Detroit-based companys aggressive strategic shift includes becoming the North American market share leader in the technology over the next few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Host_A, it's pretty wild. Mary Barra, the CEO, she laid it all out at this Barclays conference. She's saying they're gonna be the North American market share leader in EVs over the next few years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Host_A, it's pretty wild. Mary Barra, the C E O, she laid it all out at this Barclays conference. She's saying they're gonna be the North American market share leader in E V s over the next few years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla wasnt mentioned in a presentation by CEO and Chairman Mary Barra to Barclays Global Automotive conference, but the Detroit-based companys aggressive strategic shift includes becoming the North American market share leader in the technology over the next few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: North American market share leader! That's, um, a massive claim. And they're putting their money where their mouth is, right? Like another seven billion by 2025?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: North American market share leader! That's, um, a massive claim. And they're putting their money where their mouth is, right? Like another seven billion by twenty twenty five?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its budgeting an additional $7 billion between now and 2025 to help do that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. That brings their total EV and AV investment to over $27 billion. And they're planning thirty battery-powered models globally by 2025. Two-thirds of those, uh, for North America.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. That brings their total E V and A V investment to over twenty seven billion dollars. And they're planning thirty battery-powered models globally by twenty twenty five. Two-thirds of those, uh, for North America.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest U.S. automaker plans to release 30 battery-powered models globally by 2025, two-thirds of which will be available to North American customers from its Cadillac, GMC, Chevrolet and Buick brands. ... We will invest an additional $7 billion in EVs through 2025. bringing our total investment in EV and (autonomous vehicles) to over $27 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, we're talking about like, electric Hummers, Cadillac LYRIQs... [overlaps]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, we're talking about like, electric Hummers, Cadillac L Y R I Q s...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, the Hummer EV is due late 2021, Cadillac LYRIQ early 2022. It's happening fast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the Hummer E V is due late twenty twenty one, Cadillac L Y R I Q early twenty twenty two. It's happening fast.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first new model to get GMs lower-cost Ultium battery pack is the GMC Hummer EV due in late 2021 followed by the Cadillac LYRIQ crossover that arrives in early 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But you know, it's funny, GM actually pioneered EVs with the EV1 back in the day, right? They kinda, um, abandoned it. What changed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you know, it's funny, G M actually pioneered E V s with the E V one back in the day, right? They kinda, um, abandoned it. What changed?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM was a pioneer in battery-powered cars, releasing the EV1 subcompact in California 24 years ago as an early test vehicle, its abandonment of the technology created an opportunity for Musk and Tesla in the early 2000s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, like, battery costs are way down now. Plus, tougher global rules on CO2, and the Biden administration is really pushing for electric transport. It's a whole different landscape.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, like, battery costs are way down now. Plus, tougher global rules on C O two, and the Biden administration is really pushing for electric transport. It's a whole different landscape.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lower costs for batteries and components, tougher global rules to limit CO2 emissions and the incoming Biden Administration thats prioritizing electric transportation underpins the companys new strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And they're banking on this new Ultium battery, right? Supposedly, like, 40% cheaper than their current ones?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And they're banking on this new Ultium battery, right? Supposedly, like, forty percent cheaper than their current ones?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM says it will be able to sell electric vehicles with range of up to 400 miles per charge at a profit, owing to costs for its Ultium batteries that are about 40% below those currently used in its Bolt EV.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the next generation could be 60% cheaper. They're saying they can sell these EVs, uh, profitably from day one. Which is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the next generation could be sixty percent cheaper. They're saying they can sell these E V s, uh, profitably from day one. Which is huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A next-generation Ultium that arrives in a few years will be 60% cheaper than Bolt batteries... GMs EV development times are speeding up and costs are going down rapidly, so we expect our Ultium EV programs to be profitable from the first generation on, Parks said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the game-changer. I mean, Tesla wasn't even mentioned in Barra's speech, but you can feel the rivalry. Tesla's got that huge market cap, but GM's production scale is just... [overlaps]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the game-changer. I mean, Tesla wasn't even mentioned in Barra's speech, but you can feel the rivalry. Tesla's got that huge market cap, but G M's production scale is just...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla wasnt mentioned in a presentation by CEO and Chairman Mary Barra to Barclays Global Automotive conference... Teslas production capacity and earnings are a fraction of GMs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, Tesla's got the fan base and the market cap, but GM has the global manufacturing footprint. They're talking about, like, commonizing parts across product lines too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Tesla's got the fan base and the market cap, but G M has the global manufacturing footprint. They're talking about, like, commonizing parts across product lines too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...along with Musks uncommonly loyal fanbase, have made it the worlds most valuable automaker with a market capitalization of $473 billion... though it will be several years before it can match the scale of GMs global production operations. Additional cost savings will come from commonizing more parts across all of GMs product lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it's like, the sleeping giant is finally waking up, and they're coming for that top spot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's like, the sleeping giant is finally waking up, and they're coming for that top spot.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's gonna be a really interesting few years in the EV space.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's gonna be a really interesting few years in the E V space.
